page.title: 19ARMED FORCES-KEEVIL AIRFIELD
page.content: This year there has been much concern about the rumoured change of use of Keevil airfield. The Ministry of Defence has withdrawn public access with the exception of the Gliding Club and Model Aircraft Club at weekends, and the annual motor cycle rally and PHAB club sponsored walk. The dispen- sation of grazing rights on the air- field has been withdrawn and seasonal licences will be issued to farmers. Rumours of the arrival of cruise missiles, with the added hazard of 'Greenham Common' problems, have been quashed in a letter from the MOD Land Agent to the Parish Council, which was published in the Parish News. RAF Lyneham continues to use the airfield as a parachute dropping zone for their Hercules transport aircraft.It is also used for helicopter and army exercises - all to a greater extent than before.
